comment: He cares about his students but I feel like he definitely could have pushed us harder. I enjoyed the class but I didn't learn much. (which might have to do more with the content rather than the professor)

Professor Flemming is cool, it was the class that i hated. If you do not enjoy still lifes you will hate this class too, you sit still for three hours in silence to draw. This class made me switch majors. So unless art is your ENTIRE life i would recommend you dont do an art major as this would be a core for you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: this class is great if you are passionate for art. i ended up changing my major for the following semester, so i did not enjoy the class as much as someone with an art passion. he is a caring professor and does not grade harshly. he gives only a few art homework assignments and class participation is mandatory.
Just TAKE him for summer class, no question ask best professor ever.

I had Fleming in Spring 2023 and he was an amazing instructor! I'm not the best at drawing but he made the class feel accomplishable for everyone. He made sure to take time to talk with every student during our drawings and provided amazing feedback on how to improve and to not overstress it. As long as you try your best he will work with you.

Do not, I repeat, DO NOT listen to any of the ratings that give this man ANY LESS than a perfect score. In 2023, Mr. Fleming has completely and totally found his footing. So long as you show up and draw, there's no possible way you can fail. He has no tests, no nothing. JUST a little homework. He's so chill, my whole class loves him

This was his first year teaching 2-D Design & Color Theory, and I think he did an amazing job despite it. Some assignments were confusing, but he extended them for the whole class if they were giving us a hard time. He developed a great relationship with his students, provided insightful feedback, and was overall an enjoyable professor.

I really enjoyed this class he was fun and super chill and I would take him again. We had two tests which I will say they only would be hard if you did not study.  Critics were mandatory but the feedback helped a lot and you had two weeks to redo your mistakes to get a better grade. If you ask for advice he will most certainly help you.

A very friendly and laid-back professor. He always makes his criteria clear for each assignment, so you know exactly what he expects from you. His critiques are very helpful and he allows you to redo projects for a better grade. His class isnt a cakewalk, but your art will definitely improve if you follow his advice

I don't know about the other reviews, but I had Prof. Fleming for Figure Drawing this semester and he was absolutely great! He is laidback ,cracks plenty of jokes, and let's you know exactly what to fix during critiques and lets you turn it back in within a week for a better grade. He regularly compliments students progress & encourages their work!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: He was a nice guy but not the best professor. His tests werent great, they were strangely worded and hard to understand. He would take forever to grade assignments, so most of the semester you dont know what your grade is. He reads off the PowerPoint which is based off the textbook, very robotic. Overall, an easy class but frustrating.

First year teacher, very unorganized. His class was just a train wreck. He literally will give you 100's on every single assignment except tests. His tests were pretty easy if you go to the review. Other than that, he's an okay professor just very unorganized and takes literally a whole semester to put grades in.

This was his first-semester teaching. You were graded on 3 tests, a few online discussions, and a mandatory paper where you had to visit an art museum. His lectures are fast-paced and taken directly from the text. Because the majority of the class failed the second exam, he gave extra credit quizzes but refused to correct trick questions.

He makes passing the class impossible. All his lectures come directly from the textbook, so don't bother buying a book. Also, his test were ridiculous, there was just no way. However, towards the end, he took attendance as extra credit for the final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He is young, so I expected him to be pretty relatable and chill but no. I dread the class, it is extremely lecture heavy, attendance is taken towards your grade and god for bid, if your cell phone goes off, you'll be asked to leave the classroom.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy
